title: Handlebars - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Handlebar Removal HD; HD4; HD7; HDA; HE7; HF7; HG7; HH7
Remove the left hand handlebar end weight. Discard the fixing.
Release the two fixings and remove the left hand grip from the handlebar. Collect the two washers.

body.name: Left hand grip fixing (left hand grip.svg)

body.body: Release the screws and free the left switch gear assembly from the handlebar. Without disconnecting any wiring, lay the switch aside.
Release the fixings and remove the clamp from the clutch lever assembly. Without disconnecting the clutch cable, lay the lever aside.
Release the screws and free the right hand switch gear assembly from the handlebar. Without disconnecting any wiring, lay the switch aside.
Release the fixings and remove the clamp from the front brake master cylinder. Taking care to not invert the brake fluid reservoir, lay the assembly aside.
Release the fixings securing the handlebar clamp to the risers, detach the clamp and collect the handlebar.
Slide the twist grip position sensor off the handle bar and position aside.
